notes.text:
SINEC Traffic Analyzer before V2.0 is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.

Siemens has released a new version for SINEC Traffic Analyzer and recommends to update to the latest version.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: 
https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
notes.title: General Recommendations

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: Siemens Security Advisories are subject to the terms and conditions contained in Siemens' underlying license terms or other applicable agreements previously agreed to with Siemens (hereinafter "License Terms"). To the extent applicable to information, software or documentation made available in or through a Siemens Security Advisory, the Terms of Use of Siemens' Global Website (https://www.siemens.com/terms_of_use, hereinafter "Terms of Use"), in particular Sections 8-10 of the Terms of Use, shall apply additionally. In case of conflicts, the License Terms shall prevail over the Terms of Use.
notes.title: Terms of Use

references.summary: SSA-716317: Multiple Vulnerability in SINEC Traffic Analyzer Before V2.0 - HTML Version
SSA-716317: Multiple Vulnerability in SINEC Traffic Analyzer Before V2.0 - CSAF Version

document.title: SSA-716317: Multiple Vulnerability in SINEC Traffic Analyzer Before V2.0

notes.text: The affected application mounts the container's root filesystem with read and write privileges. This could allow an attacker to alter the container's filesystem leading to unauthorized modifications and data corruption.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Excessive Authentication Attempts

notes.text: The affected application do not properly enforce restriction of  excessive authentication attempts. This could allow an unauthenticated attacker to conduct brute force attacks against legitimate user credentials or keys.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

notes.text: The affected application do not have access control for accessing the files. This could allow an authenticated attacker with low privilege's to get access to sensitive information.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

cwe.name: Use of Cache Containing Sensitive Information

notes.text: The affected application does not properly handle cacheable HTTP responses in the web service. This could allow an attacker to read and modify data stored in the local cache.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version

cwe.name: Improperly Implemented Security Check for Standard

notes.text: The affected application is missing general HTTP security headers in the web server. This could allow an attacker to make the servers more prone to clickjacking attack.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.0 or later version
